instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid no display
threads.message:
Hi,
this board receive liquid near LVDS connector, the Mac start (I think) I have backlight on keyboard, light on usb mouse.
I look defect component near <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> (<CAPACITOR>C7101</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C7100</CAPACITOR>,<RESISTOR>R7101</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> and some strap).
I haven't the same board to change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, can I take it on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?
thanks
Best regards

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid no display
threads.message:
Do you get L7210/20/70 voltage?

Any <CHIP>ISL95828</CHIP> will work...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid no display
threads.message:
L7210/20/70 = 0,8V
i ear the Mac with voice over (three push on power button), I try the display on other Mac, he work well.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid no display
threads.message:
Seems that iGPU is completely damaged; not only internal eDP output.
Did you try external video disconnecting internal LCD?
